arm_group.description: Established treatment associated with placebo (riboflavin sodium fosfate 0.1%). We use riboflavin in placebo group to remain the double-blind fashion: methotrexate has a yellow color and riboflavin in that concentration has the same color.

brief_summary.textblock:
Experimental studies suggest that anti-inflammatory and immunomodulatory drugs could reduce
      the inflammatory profile in acute ischemic disease and reduce the area of ​​ischemia.
      Methotrexate is a drug that has shown promise in ischemic disease in animal studies.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effects of mETHotrexate Therapy on ST Segment Elevation MYocardial InfarctionS (TETHYS Trial)

detailed_description.textblock:
Atherosclerosis and ischemic disease have clear association with inflammation. There is an
      anti-inflammatory action of methotrexate by increasing adenosine. Experimental studies
      demonstrate reduction of infarct induced in animals treated with methotrexate. We expect a
      reduction in the area under the curve of creatine kinase (CK), creatine kinase MB fraction
      (CK-MB) and Troponin I high sensitive, decreased levels of B-type natriuretic peptide (BNP)
      and improvement in left ventricular ejection fraction.

intervention.description: The treatment group will receive a bolus dose of 0.05 mg/kg of methotrexate before primary angioplasty  followed by 0.05 mg/kg per hour for 6 hours
We use riboflavin in placebo group to remain the double-blind fashion: methotrexate has a yellow color and riboflavin in that concentration has the same color.

primary_outcome.description: The primary end point was the reduction of the size of the infarct as assessed by the area under the curve (AUC) (expressed in arbitrary units) for creatine kinase (CK) during 72 hours after the infarct
primary_outcome.measure: Area under the curve of creatine kinase

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: The primary end point was the reduction of the size of the infarct as assessed by the area under the curve (AUC) (expressed in arbitrary units) for creatine kinase MB fraction(CK-MB) and Troponin I high sensitive during 72 hours after the infarct
secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the curve for creatine kinase MB fraction and troponin I high sensitive

secondary_outcome.description: Compare the peaks of CK, CK-MB and troponin I ultra-sensitive
secondary_outcome.measure: Compare the peaks of CK, CK-MB and troponin I ultra-sensitive

secondary_outcome.description: Compare the levels of high-sensitivity C-reactive at admission, after 72 hours and after 3 months
secondary_outcome.measure: Compare the levels of high-sensitivity C-reactive protein at admission, after 72 hours and after 3 months

secondary_outcome.description: Compare the levels of erythrocyte sedimentation rate on admission and after 72 hours
secondary_outcome.measure: Compare the levels of erythrocyte sedimentation rate on admission and after 72 hours

secondary_outcome.description: Compare B-type natriuretic peptide (BNP) levels on admission, after 72 hours and after 3 months
secondary_outcome.measure: Compare B-type natriuretic peptide (BNP) levels on admission, after 72 hours and after 3 months
secondary_outcome.time_frame: On admission, after 72 hours and after 3 months

secondary_outcome.description: Compare the "TIMI frame count" of the culprit artery
secondary_outcome.measure: Compare the "TIMI frame count" of the culprit artery

secondary_outcome.description: Compare the Killip score on admission and after 72 hours;
secondary_outcome.measure: Compare the Killip score on admission and after 72 hours

secondary_outcome.description: Assess ventricular ejection fraction with transthoracic echocardiography during the first 72 hours after 3 months
secondary_outcome.measure: Assess ventricular ejection fraction with transthoracic echocardiography during the first 72 hours after 3 months
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the first 72 hours after 3 months

secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation in 72 hours the changes in the levels of hematocrit, hemoglobin, leukocytes and platelets, changes in the levels of serum glutamate oxaloacetate transaminase, serum glutamate pyruvate transaminase and prothrombin Time; changes in the levels of plasma creatinine, gastrointestinal effects (oral ulcers, diarrhea, nausea and vomiting), skin changes (rash, pruritus, and alopecia) and pulmonary effects (pneumonitis and pneumonia).
